alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 26 at 8:22PM MST until July 27 at 2:15AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Cassadore Springs burn scar in... Gila County in east central Arizona... * Until 215 AM MST. * At 822 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Cassadore Springs Burn Scar. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Cassadore Springs burn scar. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Cassadore Springs Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Cassadore Springs Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hilltop and Sawmill. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
